SEARCH
Package controller.user

Class UserManager

java.lang.Object
controller.user.UserManager
public class UserManager extends Object
The UserManager class provides utility methods for handling the functionalities of all users of the application.

  • Method Details

    • findUser

      public static User findUser(String email, UserType userType) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Find user by email and user type. This method retrieves the user with the specified email and user type (doctor, patient, pharmacist, administrator).
      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the user.
      userType - the type of user (doctor, patient, pharmacist, or administrator).
      Returns:
      the user with the specified email and user type.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - if no user is found with the specified email and user type.

    • findUserById

      public static User findUserById(String userID, UserType userType) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Find user by ID and user type. This method retrieves the user by their ID and user type (doctor, patient, pharmacist, administrator).
      Parameters:
      userID - the ID of the user.
      userType - the type of user (doctor, patient, pharmacist, or administrator).
      Returns:
      the user with the specified ID and user type.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - if no user is found with the specified ID and user type.

    • updateUser

      public static void updateUser(User user) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Update user details based on user type. This method updates the details of the user based on their type (doctor, patient, pharmacist, or administrator).
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose details need to be updated.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - if the user is not found in their respective database.

    • updateUserProfile

      public static void updateUserProfile(User user, UserType userType, Map<String,String> updatedValues) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Update user profile details. This method updates the user's profile details based on a map of updated values.
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose profile details need to be updated.
      userType - the type of the user (doctor, patient, pharmacist, or administrator).
      updatedValues - a map of profile fields to be updated, with field names as keys and new values as map entries.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - if the user is not found in their respective database.

    • loadDoctor

      public static void loadDoctor(Doctor doctor) throws ModelAlreadyExistsException
      Load a doctor. This method is used to load a doctor by calling the `createDoctor` method.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the doctor to be loaded.
      Throws:
      ModelAlreadyExistsException - if a doctor with the same ID already exists.

    • loadPatient

      public static void loadPatient(Patient patient) throws ModelAlreadyExistsException
      Load a patient. This method is used to load a patient by calling the `createPatient` method.
      Parameters:
      patient - the patient to be loaded.
      Throws:
      ModelAlreadyExistsException - if a patient with the same ID already exists.

    • createUser

      public static User createUser(String email, String name, Gender gender, int age, UserType userType, String password) throws ModelNotFoundException, ModelAlreadyExistsException
      Create a user. This method creates a user (doctor, patient, pharmacist, or administrator) based on the provided details. It assigns a unique ID to the user and creates the user in the respective database.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user.
      name - the name of the user.
      gender - the gender of the user.
      age - the age of the user.
      userType - the type of user (doctor, patient, pharmacist, or administrator).
      password - the password for the user.
      Returns:
      the newly created user.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - if the user cannot be created due to invalid or missing data.
      ModelAlreadyExistsException - if a user with the same ID already exists.

    • createUserWithUUID

      public static User createUserWithUUID(String userID, String email, String name, Gender gender, int age, UserType userType, String password) throws ModelNotFoundException, ModelAlreadyExistsException
      Create a user with a specific UUID. This method allows for creating a user (doctor, patient, pharmacist, or administrator) with a predefined UUID, instead of generating a new one. The user is created in the appropriate database based on the user type (doctor, patient, pharmacist, or administrator).
      Parameters:
      userID - the unique user ID.
      email - the email address of the user.
      name - the name of the user.
      gender - the gender of the user.
      age - the age of the user.
      userType - the type of the user (doctor, patient, pharmacist, or administrator).
      password - the password for the user.
      Returns:
      the newly created user with the provided UUID.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - if the user cannot be created due to invalid or missing data.
      ModelAlreadyExistsException - if a user with the same ID already exists.

    • getDoctors

      public static List<Doctor> getDoctors()
      Get all Doctors
      Returns:
      List of all doctors in the database

      Get all Pharmacists
      Returns:
      List of all pharmacists in the database

    • removeUserByID

      public static void removeUserByID(String staffID, UserType userType) throws ModelNotFoundException, UserCannotBeFoundException
      Remove a user by their ID and user type.
      Parameters:
      staffID - the ID of the staff member to be removed
      userType - the type of the user (DOCTOR, PATIENT, PHARMACIST, ADMINISTRATOR)
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - if the user could not be found in the database
      UserCannotBeFoundException - if the user with the given ID and type does not exist
